key_points: There is a debate in Washington D.C. about additional stimulus money for American families.
Previous COVID stimulus payments included amounts of $1,200, $600, and $1,400, with the last signed by President Biden in March 2021.
The American Rescue Plan expanded the federal Child Tax Credit, providing direct payments to families.
Families receive $300 for each child under 6, and $250 for each child ages 6 to 17, between July and December of 2021.
A family with one child under 6 will receive $1,800 by December 2021 through the advanced payments.
Families not normally filing a tax return could still benefit if they notified the IRS by November 15.
These eligible families will receive half of their total Child Tax Credit in a single payment on December 15.
Potential one-time payments are up to $1,800 for each child under 6, and up to $1,500 for each child ages 6 to 17.
The future of the expanded Child Tax Credit is uncertain, with the Biden administration aiming to make it permanent.
Democratic Senator Joe Manchin wants to make changes to the Child Tax Credit payments.
